sentences.sContent: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.sCn: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.sContent: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.sCn: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.sContent: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.sCn: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

synos.tran: 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

remMethod.val: aw(看作awe， 恐惧) ＋ kward(看作backward， 向后的) → 由于恐惧所以向后退 → 尴尬的场面 → 尴尬的

trans.tranOther: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say
